item.title: Gamestop's Pre-Order Ad Holds a Mirror up to Consumers
item.dc:creator: adib
item.content:encoded:
The Shift in Gaming Revenue

So much for "Power to the players."
The gaming industry has seen a massive shift in recent years for their revenue models. Consumers seem to have no problem with paying more for games with less content than ever. On top of this, companies rely heavily on revenue from microtransactions, pre-order, and DLC purchases. While there is nothing inherently wrong with selling additional content for a game, companies like Ubisoft, EA, and countless others partake in shady deals to both maximize profits and screw over consumers along the way. Recently, Gamestop released an advertisement for Ubisofts latest installment in the Assassins Creed series, and its had everyone in the gaming community stirring. The ad sums up everything wrong with the DLC Culture in gaming.

Pre-Order Bonuses

[caption id="attachment_708" align="aligncenter" width="157"] Gamestop's Assassin's Creed pre-order Ad[/caption] Yes, this is an actual advertisement from Gamestop. What may seem like a joke about pre-order bonuses at first glance is an actual promotion from Gamestop, encouraging pre-order purchases. "Sorry. The bonus mission is blocked. Unless you pre-order Assassins Creed Origins." First of all, pre-order bonuses are one of the scummiest business practices in the gaming industry. Developers use valuable production time to create additional content sold separately from the base game. This effectively takes away from base game production time. It also goes without saying that they are locking pre-existing content from consumers.

Is it Ever Acceptable?

Coming out with true additional content for a game is certainly a fair way to earn revenue. However, locking away pre-existing content is unfair to consumers at its core, but, game developers don't seem to have the same mindset. Paywalls, special editions, and pre-orders have been very profitable for creators but often leave the consumers in the dark.

The Beginning of a Big Issue

GameStops advertisement is just a small window into the world of milking consumers in the gaming industry. GTA V has gained some negative reviews due to their expensive in-game currency, and Call of Duty has been marketing pre-order bonuses for years. If consumers continue to feed companies that milk consumers, other companies will join in, and from there, it wont be long until every game, even from galaxies far, far away, will accept money for outrageous content and pay-to-win schemes. Check out my video covering the topic: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iR8vK4cbYDc&t

item.title: Top 10 FREE Steam Games!!
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.content:encoded: Let's face it, in all honest gaming is an expensive hobby and/or passion, hardware costs a lot of money as do modern games with many games retailing at over $60 new, not including the many DLC's that developer s introduce to try and squeeze more money out of the unsuspecting consumer. This is why I think that it is important to occasionally step back from Triple A titlesand look at some of the free games available on PC, whilstnot all free games the best, many of them put much more premium games to shame and have been guaranteed classics for many years. 1: War Thunder War Thunder is an increasingly popular MMO World War 2 combat game. It features arcade style or realistic settings for the vast array of vehicles included, tanks and planes as well as stunning graphics that put many premium games to shame. It evens features cross compatibility between platforms! Whilst progress in this game when researching new aircraft can be slow, it sure is not a problem due to the games addictive nature.

item.dc:creator: ziad
item.content:encoded:
Looking for a murderous father in your area? Man have I got the man for you. Mad Father is a German based game where you follow the life of a little girl named Aya, daughter to a scientist who also may or may not be a psychopath that you really should let die alone. Whatever though, I dont judge. Your whole goal in this game is to save your father from the experiments hes created by murdering and angering a shite ton of people. Story of my life.
Okay, onward. Mad Father is a single player puzzle/adventure/horror game where you go through your labyrinth of a mansion, and holy cow, where did David Bowie come from. This mansion should not have this big of a basement anyway. As you go along, you realize just how many people have died to your Vaders chainsaw, or hand, chainsaw is cooler. Really, this is no spoiler, one second into the game and oh, someone died.
Aya Drevis is the main character you play as throughout the whole game, there are some other people you play as, but really, that doesnt last long, and Ill leave it to you to figure out what the hell all of these people are doing zombieing your house. The save station is pretty easy, a crow follows you everywhere, and really, if you die because you didnt save and the crow is in every room you are in, then it is not my fault. I recommend saving, a lot.
Aya is completely and utterly devoted to her father and her bunny, Snowball. Her late mother died to a sickness, and Aya has become dependent on her fathers love, even disliking the maid, Maria, for taking her fathers attention. So imagine waking up in the middle of the night to your fathers screaming, youd be pretty wtf too. Did I mention its the anniversary of your mothers death as well? Isnt that nice.
Next up is Alfred Drevis, Ayas father. He is a scientist, completely dedicated to his work. He loves Aya very much, but rarely has time to spend with her anymore, as he works a lot. Aya has been onto what he does in the basement for quite some time, but does that stop him? Nope. Next comes the maid, and Alfreds assistant, Maria, who after his late wife, Monika Drevis death, began a romantic relationship with her.
Overall, the game itself is quite straight forward, and has a lot of characters for you to figure out and feel bad for. Ill leave you guys to figure the characters out for yourselves. A definite recommend for a heart attack and smash that button or youll die moment.
So yeah, save that shit.

item.dc:creator: ziad
item.content:encoded:
*text* - Point this out really clearly (and loudly)

(squeaky voice) self explanatory

-text- - insert video based on text

Try to not rush words, take the time to pronounce words = video can artificially be longer. Focus more on clear voice and proper pronunciation.

Can you actually feel ultra settings while you game? Have you ever questioned yourself with this question? Would you actually go that far for ultra details even if it's hurting your FPS really bad?

-a short dramatic scene of fps between all maxed out and tuned settings-

Today, games are mostly benchmarked on Ultra settings. But in reality, sometimes even the most powerful cards can struggle to output 60 frames in really demanding games. Let's take for example GTX 1070 which is by no mean even close to being considered as most powerful GPU(but is available to 3 of us). And as a resolution, we'll take 1080p for this example. You'd think OH BOY, 1070 SHOULD BE MORE THAN CAPABLE OF RUNNING GAMES ON MAX SETTINGS (squeaky voice)

In games such as GTA V, you just *CAN NOT* max out EVERY SINGLE setting and constantly get over 60 fps. It's really hard to get that in your head, even in 2017. GTA V came out on PC in 2015 and today you still have to turn down some of the really taxing settings to achieve back normal framerates for that game, considering resolution and GPU it's played on. With some specific settings, you get into the zone of diminishing returns really quickly. Turning them down gets you from 50-55fps to 90fps while the actual difference is minimal, sometimes not even existent.

Which leads to the point of this video. Are games worth running on maxed settings? The answer is of course no. SOMETIMES you really need to look closely to see a difference between High, Very High and Ultra preset on today's games.

item.title: The *NEW* Nvidia GTX 1070Ti - Does It Make Sense?
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.content:encoded:
So it seems the recent speculation over the alleged GTX 1070Ti has proven to be true. Today NVIDIA revealed its brand new GTX 1070Ti Graphics card. The chip is proposed as a solution to rival AMD's Vega 56 chip which outperforms the regular 1070 in many areas. The new Geforce 1070Ti card comes in a $449 putting it right between the GTX 1070 and the GTX 1080 costing $399 and $499 respectively. This makes the card an excellent choice for anyone who wants more power than the 1070 but cannot justify the cost of a GTX 1080. NVidia claims that the card should offer around double the performance of the previous generation GTX 970. Potentially proving a great upgrade path for users stuck on the previous generation. [caption id="" align="alignnone" width="1280"] A photo of the brand new 1070Ti![/caption] The new card is based on the GP104 pascal chip that has a modest base clock of 1607Mhz with a boost clock of 1683Mhz. The Regular 1070 has a base clock of 1506Mhz and a boost of 1683Mhz. Whilst the GTX 1080 has a base clock of 1607Mhz and a boost clock of 1733Mhz. However, with GPU Boost 3 technology the cards should be able to reach theoretical higher clocks. At around 8.1 Teraflops of performance, the GTX 1070Ti boasts 2432 CUDA cores, just 128 LESS than the GTX 1080. Meanwhile, the Regular 1070 features just 1920 CUDA cores for a reasonable 6.1 Teraflops of performance. Therefore the 1070Ti SHOULD be closer to a GTX 1080 than a GTX 1070. But the 1070Ti has 256Gbps of VRAM Bandwidth like the GTX 1070. The 1080 and 1080Ti, on the other hand, have 320Gbps of Bandwidth. The 1070Ti also uses the same GDDR5 VRAM as the GTX 1070 rather than the faster GDDR5X VRAM found on the 1080Ti and above. [caption id="" align="alignnone" width="1200"] Is this card the best bang for the buck?![/caption]

Further Thoughts...

On reflection, it is easy to see why NVIDIA has decided to make a card between the midrange 1070 and the high-end 1080. It seems to offer a great buffer between the two cards as well as a crippling blow to the already struggling Vega 56 card. In time, it should be interesting to see the benchmarks that this card achieves, especially with the overclocked third-party variants that are due to follow. Hopefully, the VRAM limitations of this card do not hold it back from becoming a powerful and well-positioned GPU in the market.

item.title: EA's Battlefront II and The Rise of Micro-Transactions
item.dc:creator: adib
item.content:encoded:
Poor business practices have reached galaxies far, far away.

The Shift in Revenue

In recent years, the mainstream gaming industry has seen a massive shift in their business models and revenue earning tactics. Renowned publishers including Rockstar Games, EA, and Ubisoft now heavily advertise and rely on the sales of micro-transactions and DLC. This is on top of the initial purchase of their $80 game.

The Micro-Transaction Model

Micro-transactions as a business model have been commonplace in free to play games, such as mobile games like Candy Crush. Candy Crush is whats known as a freemium app, making it available to download for free, including in-app purchases. This model has been widely successful for King, the Candy Crush developers. Candy Crush Saga has an estimated $2.1 million of estimated revenue per day, just through in-app purchases. The freemium business model has transferred into AAA games such as Grand Theft Auto V, EA, and Ubisoft. On top of charging customers with the initial price of the game, they are often pressured into paying for in-game items such as currency, character unlocks, and skins. This model has been very lucrative for publishers, even with major backlash from consumers. Rockstar games have sold over 60 million copies of GTA V and brought in over $500 million from the online component of their game after release through micro-transactions.

From Mobile Games to AAA

Ive spent a good amount of money on League of Legends, but thats a free-to-play game. Seeing $80 games like Star Wars and GTA force people to pay more money is ridiculous, and an obvious money grab, a PCMRHub member says. The latest micro-scandal in the industry was the release of Star Wars Battlefront 2, by a common culprit, EA. Seriously? I paid 80$ to have Vader locked? an SWBF subreddit user posts.

The Dark Side

EAs response to this statement stated that unlocking characters such as Darth Vader provides players with a sense of pride and accomplishment. They faced major backlash for this statement, soon becoming the most downvoted comment on Reddit, with over 677 000 downvotes. Although EA reduced the number of credits required to unlock some characters, they also increased the amount of time required to unlock them. Many loyal Star Wars fans feel slapped in the face by EA. [caption id="attachment_731" align="aligncenter" width="890"] Star Wars Battlefront 2 Loot Boxes[/caption]

A Game of Numbers

Some pro-consumers took the liberty of calculating how much time or money it would take to unlock all characters in Star Wars Battlefront 2. Star Wars Gaming estimates that it would take over 4000 hours or $2100 to unlock all characters. Coming out with true additional content for a game is a fair way to earn revenue. Locking pre-existing content behind unreasonable amounts of play time is unfair to consumers at the core, an anonymous gamer says.

Is it Ever Okay?

In a capitalist society, companies will always try to earn as much revenue as possible, which is understandable and fair. When consumers continue to feed money to publishers, other companies will join in, thus creating a slippery slope to every company introducing micro-transactions into their game.

item.title: Bitcoin - Currency v2.0?
item.dc:creator: adib
item.content:encoded:
The Rise of Bitcoin

The rapid surge in the value of Bitcoin in recent months has captivated the attention of tech enthusiasts and investors alike. On January 1st, 2017, the value of Bitcoin was $997.69 USD, and by November 30th of the same year, the value of this cryptocurrency rose by nearly 894%. [caption id="attachment_738" align="aligncenter" width="1481"] Bitcoin Market Value Graph[/caption] Bitcoin was originally released in 2008 as the first decentralized digital currency, without any association with banks, unlike traditional currency. Many consumers used Bitcoins to make purchases anonymously. However, the volatility of Bitcoin makes it impractical to use as a primary form of currency.

Real Life Implications

Valve, a multi-billion dollar corporation recently announced that they would no longer accept Bitcoin as payment through Steam due to high fees and volatility. James Collins-Warren, a business student, occasionally trades bitcoin. Bitcoin is too expensive to be used as a currency, Collins-Warren says. Despite the volatility and impracticalities, Bitcoin continues to rise in popularity to investors. The value continues to rise at staggering levels.

item.title: PUBG 1.0 - The Beauty of an Early Access Release
item.dc:creator: adib
item.content:encoded:
The Little Game That Could

Player Unknown Battlegrounds (PUBG) has made leaps and bounds in its development process to make the game enjoyable for all users on the PC, and its 1.0 update fixes almost all the original problems with the game. PUBG entered Steam in March of 2017 as one of the seemingly infinite Early Access titles that litter the marketplace, many of which were abandoned and would never see a 1.0 release. Bluehole was able to bring massive popularity to their game through fresh gameplay, a strong development team, and massive coverage on sites including Twitch and YouTube. The game was extremely popular, even in early access, as it often had more concurrent players than some of Valves own creations, such as Dota 2 and CS: GO. [caption id="attachment_744" align="aligncenter" width="732"] PUBG's player count analytics.[/caption]

Early Access Doubts

Although PUBG created a new experience for players in the shooter genre, pundits and players alike had their doubts about the future of PUBG, and how Bluehole would handle the massive popularity of their game. Many early access games have seen immense popularity in a short amount of time, only to lose all support from developers in mere months. Once consumers pay for the game, the developer has no incentive to continue spending time and resources improving their game. Akin to many titles in early access, PUBG was nothing short of a broken mess. The game was extremely unoptimized, experienced major bugs, and overall, could not be considered a playable experience. Many feared that with the massive success Bluehole found, game abandonment would be imminent. Bluehole didnt appear to abandon their game, as they made weekly updates while in early access, but players would remain skeptical.

Proving Everyone Wrong

All skeptics were proven completely wrong after the game left Early Access. Firstly, Bluehole did something many Early Access developers never did; release their game. After the release of 1.0, almost all performance issues were fixed, and bugs were minimal. Bluehole truly fixed their game, and players were ecstatic. Bluehole was able to prove that they were extremely competent and that PUBG was in good hands. This may be seen as an example of how beneficial Early Access is to consumers and developers. Without funding from gamers, Bluehole may have never been able to develop the successful game that is PUBG. PUBG's popularity continues to grow immensely, seemingly by the day. [caption id="attachment_746" align="aligncenter" width="716"] PUBG's Growth By Month.[/caption] The massive growth and improvements show that Bluehole is ready to allocate anything to perfect their game.

PUBG 1.0 Benchmarks

[caption id="attachment_745" align="aligncenter" width="937"] 1.0 Benchmarks taken from "Hardware Unboxed"[/caption]

item.title: SpaceX Satellites Bring Internet to the Masses
item.dc:creator: adib
item.content:encoded:
The Power of Tintin

On February 22nd, SpaceX launched a pair of satellites into orbit, which may spur the world into a global internet system, with high speed, reliable, and affordable internet access anywhere on Earth. Normally, launching satellites into orbit is extremely expensive, but the cost was massively reduced, as it was launched from the Falcon 9 rocket already due for space. Satellite broadband is not a new conception, but until the SpaceX project, it has been a niche market.

What Makes SpaceX Different?

SpaceX has set itself apart from other satellite broadband services by placing their satellites in a much lower orbital position, with the intent to speed up its services. Internet access using satellites can be very effective, as it can cover larger areas more effectively, and Elon Musks company plans to deploy over 7, 000 satellites in the lower orbit of the Earth.

Building Tensions

An anonymous Canadian student holds great disdain for his service provider. My family pays $80 per month for unreliable, capped internet. If SpaceX internet goes mainstream, Ill be thrilled with the lower prices and faster internet, he states. Recently, ISPs such as Bell, Rogers, Verizon, and other ISPs have been increasing their internet prices with no return. SpaceX's projected plans will drastically undercut other ISPs, causing better service worldwide. The floodgates of repealing net neutrality leave the future of the internet unclear.

Ultra Fast Internet At Ultra Low Prices

[caption id="attachment_1467" align="aligncenter" width="602"] Projected SpaceX Internet plans and pricing models.[/caption] Shehtaz Ruslan, a third-year engineering student at UOIT is waiting patiently for the release of Musks internet. I spent most of my childhood in a third world country, where the internet was a luxury. I believe the internet is a necessity and it looks like SpaceXs program will perform a great service to the world.

The Future of the Internet

ISPs do not feel that they need to build internet lines in rural areas, so the worldwide satellites could bring access to many, who would otherwise remain under extremely expensive ISPs, or without internet at all. The internet holds an immense amount of knowledge that helps students, businesses, and others thrive in the 21st century, and SpaceX is on track to provide affordable internet access and connect the last billion people on earth to the internet.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: SpaceX launched a pair of satellites into orbit, which may spur the world into a global internet system, with high speed, reliable, and affordable internet access anywhere on Earth.

item.title: The Rise of Fortnite
item.dc:creator: adib
item.content:encoded:
The Flood of Battle Royales

Among the multitude of battle royale games flooding the market, Fortnite has made its way to the top, with a record of 3.4 million concurrent players, dethroning PUBG, a worldwide phenomenon in gaming. Traditionally, Battle Royal is a term referencing a fight with many competitors, battling until one person remains standing. In Fortnite: Battle Royale, 100 players battle against each other on a large map with a variety of weapons and strategies until one player remains standing. In a matter of months, its become one of the most popular video games in history. [caption id="attachment_1498" align="aligncenter" width="1920"] The free-to-play game that's taken the gaming industry by storm.[/caption]

A New Type of Game

Many gamers consider Fortnite to be their favorite game. Arafat Syed appreciates the variety. Im just glad theres something different. A rehashed Call of Duty game gets old after the tenth iteration, he chuckles. The game continues to rise in popularity, as pop star Drake live streamed the game and pulled in almost 600, 000 concurrent viewers on Twitch. The free-to-play title has spurred hundreds of YouTube and Twitch channels dedicated to the game, and its become a household name in the entertainment industry. Fortnite has proven that formulaic shooter games may not always be the answer. Of course, games such as Call of Duty and Battlefield have grossed hundreds of millions of dollars, but many players feel that the gameplay has become repetitive, and borderline unplayable. Games such as Fortnite and PUBG have created innovation in the gaming industry, and the creators continue to reap massive awards for their work. Jimmy Zhang, an avid gamer and tech enthusiast doesnt believe Fortnite deserves its praise.

Criticism

Theres nothing to work for when it comes to Fortnite. You enter the game, and in 15 minutes youre out. You either win or you lose, and theres nothing in between. I cant really complain though. Its a free game, and its fun for the first hour, he retorts. Many believe that Fortnites mechanics are too simple, and dont provide enough content for the players. The only goal is to defeat 99 other players, by any means necessary. Clearly, many have already gotten bored of the game. Others believe that it provides an unmatched experience. Its a rush. When you beat out the other 98 people and its just you and the other guy, you can feel your heart pounding in your chest. You feel a real sense of accomplishment, Tyler Hong exclaims. The saying "What goes up, must come down," hasn't appeared to affect Fortnite in any way so far. Beyond the criticism and controversy of Fortnite, Epic Games F2P title has made waves in the gaming community and doesnt show any sign of slowing down. It has spurred hundreds of YouTube videos and Twitch content, created a merchandising industry and pulled in over 3 million users in the span of 7 months. The game has released as an Early Access title on Xbox One, Playstation 4, PC and on mobile devices. Cross-platform playing between systems is not officially supported but is still possible. Next: SpaceX's Prototype Satellites

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Fortnite has made its way to the top, with a record of 3.4 million concurrent players, dethroning PUBG, a worldwide phenomenon in gaming.

item.title: Battlefield Fans Torn - The New Direction of Battlefield V
item.dc:creator: adib
item.content:encoded:
The Long Awaited Battlefield V Approaches

As October 19th approaches, Battlefield veterans and new players alike consistently find themselves divided on the direction that Dices Battlefield V is taking by forgoing historical authenticity, immersive gameplay, and the hard push for cosmetics.

A Checkered Past

As a title published by EA, players are skeptical of the poor business practices the publisher may make, as they have done in their controversial release of Star Wars: Battlefront II in late 2017.

Taking a New Direction

Many players choose to play Battlefield over the vastly more popular Call of Duty series due to its attention to detail, immersive and tactical gameplay, as well as its attempts to create a historically immersive atmosphere, such as with the wildly successful Battlefield 1. However, the latest installment plans to make vast changes to all aspects of the game to appeal to a wider audience.   The reveal trailer for the game currently sits at over 400 000 dislikes, with a mere 330 000 like to counteract it. Many commenters state that they will boycott the game due to its unrealistic approach, the introduction of women in a WWII setting, as well as the outlandish cosmetics available for purchase.

Appealing to the Masses

Many pundits believe that Dice is taking this approach to appeal to an emerging progressive population of gamers who value equal representation and choice over immersion and accuracy. Battlefield 1 did receive minor pushback due to its decision to remain immersive through making all playable online characters men, while CoD: Infinite Warfare allows players to fully customize their characters. Their act of forgoing immersion is seen as a PR stunt to appeal to a wider audience and gain a larger portion of the market share in the FPS genre.

Form Over Function

The customization also presents an issue in competitive gameplay, as it will be significantly more difficult to differentiate between enemies and allies. Ryan Mcarthur, the Producer for Engagement and Core Gameplay on Battlefield V responds to a question about cosmetics by writing At this point we are not planning to implement a kill switch on cosmetics. Many have responded to this announcement with frustration, as it cements the idea that the creators care about widening their audience and providing a progressive friendly game, rather than a game focused on immersion, mechanics, and solid gameplay.

The Roaring Debate

Though gamers are split between the decisions of Battlefield V, most players have reprimanded the responses they were met with after providing their criticisms. Rather than clearly defining the genre and direction of the new game in fear of alienating any audiences, the executives remain ambiguous about the level of historical accuracy in the game and villainize the players who enjoy Battlefield as a historical experience, as it was in Battlefield 1. An executive on the team speaks about those against gender diversity by saying "These are people who are uneducated - they don't understand that this is a plausible scenario... We stand up for the cause, because I think those people who don't understand it, well, you have two choices: either accept it or don't buy the game" Many believe that the executives do not care about gender diversity, and are simply pandering to grow their audience to a larger, less devoted crowd. It is also evident that the team does not take kindly to criticism from fans. Over 2 months after the initial reveal trailer, gamers are still debating on either side on whether Battlefields direction change will be positive or negative, and the ambiguity of the developers and publisher does not allow for any one side to prevail in the debate. Many players anxiously wait for the release of their game to form a definitive opinion on the new direction Dices Battlefield V is taking. Read More: SpaceX Internet
